thread.title: This weekend’s Bay Area arts and entertainment picks
thread.title_full: This weekend’s Bay Area arts and entertainment picks - SFGate

author: sfgate.com
title: This weekend’s Bay Area arts and entertainment picks
text:
“3 Still Standing”: A new documentary about San Francisco veteran comics Will Durst, Johnny Steele and Larry Bubbles Brown. 7 p.m. Friday, Oct. 9. Roxie Theater, S.F. (415) 863-1087. www.roxie.com. 
Jamie xx: The British dance music producer, a member of the xx, is on tour in support of his solo album, “In Colour.” 8 p.m. Friday, Oct. 9. Fox Theater, Oakland. www.ticketmaster.com. 
Bread and Puppet Theatre: The seminal radical street theater makes a rare Bay Area visit with its widely influential 1965 antiwar giant-puppet piece “Fire.” 7 p.m. Friday, Oct. 9. Internet Archive, 300 Funston Ave., S.F. www.brownpapertickets.com , www.breadandpuppet.org. 
Sophia Ro and Keisuke Nakagoshi: The violin-piano duo offer a free recital featuring sonatas by Beethoven and Fauré. 1 p.m. Friday, Oct. 9. Knuth Music Hall, San Francisco State University. http://music.sfsu.edu. 
David Schein: One of the founding members of the widely influential Blake Street Hawkeyes returns to the Bay Area with two solos, “Out Comes Butch,” one person’s comic segue through gender identities, and “Distraction,” about living with his cell phone. 8 p.m. Friday, Oct. 9. Through Oct. 17. Footloose, Exit Theatre, 156 Eddy St., S.F. (800) 838-3006. www.ftloose.org. 
“The Nance”: Regional premiere of Douglas Carter Beane’s recent Broadway hit about the perilous backstage life of a burlesque artist who specializes in flamboyantly gay characters in 1930s New York. Opens 8 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 10. Through Nov. 1. New Conservatory Theatre Center, 25 Van Ness Ave., S.F. (415) 861-8972. www.nctcsf.org.
